item.title: EU Tells Shein to Tackle Consumer Law Breaches or Face Fines
item.description: Shein Group Ltd., the Singapore-based e-commerce firm, was warned by European Union regulators it could face fines unless it clamps down on consumer protection violations on its platform.
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli

media:content.media:description: A Shein pop-up store in Dublin, Ireland. Photographer: Paulo Nunes dos Santos/Bloomberg

item.title: Meituan Warns Local Rivalry, Global Push to Hurt Profitability
item.description: Meituan warned its profitability may suffer as the Chinese food delivery leader faces intensifying competition at home and is aggressively expanding into new markets.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: Food delivery couriers for Meituan in Shanghai, China. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: ChatGPT’s Improved Memory Points Toward a More Personal AI
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr reports on the improvements recently announced to the major consumer chatbots that have made it easier for them to know more about their users.
item.dc:creator: Austin Carr

media:content.media:description: The ChatGPT artificial intelligence mobile phone app.

item.title: HKBN CEO Says China Mobile’s Takeover Offer Undervalues Company
item.description: China Mobile Ltd.’s takeover offer for HKBN Ltd. undervalues the company, according to the Hong Kong broadband provider’s top executive.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Dong Cao

media:content.media:description: Signage for HKBN Ltd. in Hong Kong.

item.title: GMO Group Scraps $2 Billion Share Sale Plan of Internet Unit
item.description: The Japanese conglomerate GMO Internet Group Inc. canceled a planned share offering of one of its listed arms after the stock surged in recent months, pushing up the unit’s valuation.
item.dc:creator: Yasutaka Tamura

item.title: OpenAI to Set Up Shop in South Korea to Spur Further Growth
item.description: OpenAI has established a legal entity in South Korea, seeking to propel further adoption of its artificial intelligence technologies.
item.dc:creator: Yoolim Lee

item.title: China’s Meituan, Xiaomi See Long-Term Expansion Efforts in Spotlight
item.description: Meituan and Xiaomi Corp.’s long-term ambitions and investment plans will dominate this week’s earnings releases, continuing to shape sentiment for China’s tech sector.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo, Reina Sasaki, Justina T Lee, Harshita Swaminathan

item.title: Jony Ive’s OpenAI Deal Puts Pressure on Apple to Find Next Big Thing
item.description: Jony Ive’s deal with OpenAI should cause major shockwaves at Apple, especially after a design-team brain drain and struggles in artificial intelligence. Also: Apple plans Meta-like smart glasses for late next year, and Trump threatens a 25% smartphone tariff. Looking ahead to WWDC, we have the latest details on the company’s operating system redesign plan and what’s likely to be its biggest AI announcement.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: CUPERTINO, CA - SEPTEMBER 12: Apple chief design officer Jony Ive (L) and Apple CEO Tim Cook inspect the new iPhone XR during an Apple special event at the Steve Jobs Theatre on September 12, 2018 in Cupertino, California. Apple released three new versions of the iPhone and an update Apple Watch. (Photo by Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)

item.title: Pakistan Allocates 2,000-MW Capacity to Power Bitcoin Mining
item.description: Pakistan has allocated 2,000 megawatts of electricity in the first phase of a national push to support Bitcoin mining and AI data centers, as the country moves to legalize cryptocurrency and attract foreign investments.
item.dc:creator: Faseeh Mangi, Ashutosh Joshi

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk under a Bitcoin cryptocurrency symbol displayed at a cryptocurrency exchange shop in Pristina on January 17, 2022. - Kosovo police on January 8 seized hundreds of cryptocurrency mining machines and arrested one person in the tense ethnic-Serb majority north as the country suffered an energy crisis. Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin are created through solving complex equations -- an endeavour that consumes enormous amounts of energy. Tensions between the Serb-majority area and the ethnic Albanian majority government are running high and Kosovo's government on Tuesday brought in a temporary ban on cryptocurrency mining in an effort to bring down electricity consumption. (Photo by Armend NIMANI / AFP) (Photo by ARMEND NIMANI/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: Armend Nimani/AFP

item.title: Brin’s Mystery $700 Million Stock Gift Went to Philanthropies
item.description: Sergey Brin’s mystery gift this week of Alphabet Inc. shares valued at almost $700 million went to a trio of philanthropic organizations, according to a spokesperson for his family office.
item.dc:creator: Biz Carson

media:content.media:description: Sergey Brin attends the 11th Breakthrough Prize ceremony at Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, California, on April 5, 2025.
